sentences.en: a child’s developing sense of self
sentences.cn: 儿童逐渐形成的自我意识

sentences.en: He fiercely criticised self-styled educational experts for ignoring Shakespeare.
sentences.cn: 他强烈批评那些无视莎士比亚的自诩为教育专家的人。

sentences.en: He has never exhibited the self-confidence, bordering on arrogance, of his predecessor.
sentences.cn: 他从未表现出他前任的那种近乎傲慢的自信。

sentences.en: He tried hard not to smile in smug self-satisfaction.
sentences.cn: 他强忍住沾沾自喜的笑容。

sentences.en: I felt so self-conscious under Luke's mother's intense gaze.
sentences.cn: 在卢克母亲审视的目光下，我感到极不自在。

sentences.en: It was so humiliating, a terrible blow to my self-esteem.
sentences.cn: 这件事如此丢脸，深深地挫伤了我的自尊心。

sentences.en: Lacking self-confidence and maturity, many teenagers are left feeling very vulnerable.
sentences.cn: 许多十几岁的孩子既缺乏自信又不够懂事，所以感情上十分脆弱。

sentences.en: Most religions teach you to be truthful and self-disciplined.
sentences.cn: 多数宗教教导人们要真诚和律己。

sentences.en: Officials were self-congratulatory about how well the day had gone.
sentences.cn: 官员们对那一天的顺利度过自鸣得意。

sentences.en: She handed the cigar back to Jason with a self-satisfied smile.
sentences.cn: 她得意地笑着把雪茄给贾森递了回去。

sentences.en: She summoned up all her pity for him, to smother her self-pity.
sentences.cn: 她抑制着心中的自怜，将满腔的怜悯之情都倾注在了他的身上。

sentences.en: She visualized him stomping to his car, the picture of self-righteousness.
sentences.cn: 她想象着他噔噔噔地走向车子，一副自以为是的模样。

sentences.en: The colonies were claiming a larger measure of self-government.
sentences.cn: 殖民地正要求获得更大程度上的自治。

sentences.en: The events in Los Angeles have sparked a new national self-examination.
sentences.cn: 发生在洛杉矶的事件再次引发了全国范围的反思。

sentences.en: Those who suffer from narcissism become self-absorbed or chronic show-offs.
sentences.cn: 被自恋症折磨的人会变得只专注于自己的事情，或者不断地自我炫耀。

sentences.en: What they said was a real knock to my self-confidence.
sentences.cn: 他们的话是对我自信心的一次重大打击。

words.tran_cn: 自私自利；自我中心；任性

trans.tran_en: the type of person you are, your character, your typical behaviour etc

trans.tran_cn: 使自花授精，使近亲繁殖
